docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The main agency that accredits hospitals in the United States said today that it would require them to have formal policies specifying when doctors and nurses may refrain from trying to resuscitate patients who are terminally ill.

headline.main: HOSPITAL TOLD TO DRAFT POLICY ON CARE AT END

docs.snippet: LEAD: The main agency that accredits hospitals in the United States said today that it would require them to have formal policies specifying when doctors and nurses may refrain from trying to resuscitate patients who are terminally ill.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: HOSPITALS, JOINT COMMISSION ON ACCREDITATION OF

byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The spread of the AIDS virus among intravenous drug users continues unabated, an expert reported today, despite some success in persuading drug users to avoid contaminated needles and syringes.

headline.main: SPREAD OF AIDS VIRUS IS UNABATED AMONG INTRAVENOUS DRUG TAKERS

docs.snippet: LEAD: The spread of the AIDS virus among intravenous drug users continues unabated, an expert reported today, despite some success in persuading drug users to avoid contaminated needles and syringes.

byline.original: By LAWRENCE K. ALTMAN, Special to the New York Times
